meta_description: Check out the museum to discover three levels of historic car exhibits and themed galleries. Whether a school group or car enthusiast, this museum is a must-see destination for all!
hours_text:
# Visit

[Buy Your Tickets](https://acdamstore.com/products/museum-general-admission)

###### All You Need to Know Before Your Visit

Hours

##### Hours

  * The Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum is open seven days a week!
  * 9 a.m. - 5 p.m.
  * The museum is closed on New Year’s Day, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day only

Admission

##### **Adult Admission:**

  * $15.00 per person

##### **Adult Group of 10 or more**:**

  * $13.00 per person
    * **To schedule your group visit please fill out our online registration form.** Reservations are necessary at least (1) week in advance to receive the group rate. Lunch packages are available.

[**REGISTRATION FORM**](https://acdam.wufoo.com/forms/z1sxnlw00kj4zeu/)

##### **Children under 18 years of age:**

  * $10.00 per person

##### **Children under 6 years of age:**

  * **FREE**

##### **Family Rate:**

  * $42.00 per family
    * This rate is available to parents and their dependent children at the same address that are 18 years of age or younger.

##### **Campus Rates:**

**_These rates allow visitors entry into both Auburn Cord Duesenberg Museum and National Auto & Truck Museum._**

  * Adult: $25.00
  * Child (6-18): $15.00
  * Family*: $60.00
    * This rate is available to parents and their dependent children at the same address that are 18 years of age or younger.
  * Adult Group Tour of 10 or More: $20

[REGISTRATION FORM](https://acdam.wufoo.com/forms/z1sxnlw00kj4zeu/)

##### **Museums for All:**

Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum

# Museum General Admission

## [ Museum General Admission  ](/products/museum-general-admission)

#### Purchase Your Tickets Ahead of Time

Want to purchase tickets for your group before coming to the museum? Now you can. Please note, General Admission tickets do not work for special events being held at the museum.

Student Tickets are for people 18 years old or younger. Family tickets are for parents and their dependents who all reside at the same address.

Children 5 and under visit for free.

Tickets purchased through this website do not expire. 

You can pick your tickets up at the museum store when you arrive. Please visit the store and give them your name. That's all you need to do.

collections_text:
## Museum Events

We have special events perfect for everyone!

[ Feb 07 | 11:00amJoin us for a Highlights Tour at the Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum, happening every first Saturday of the month at 11:00 AM! This complimentary tour is included with your admission and lasts about 45 minutes. Our knowledgeable docents will explore not only the iconic vehicles in our galleries but also broader themes of automotive history and the Art Deco era. Delve into the fascinating stories behind the cars, the cultural influences of the time, and the technological innovations that shaped the automotive landscape. ](/events/museum-programs/highlights-tour-the-history-of-parties)[ Feb 14 | 5:30pmJoin us on Saturday, February 14th, 2026, from 6 to 10 PM, as we welcome you into the Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum for a Bootlegger’s Ball where love and the prohibition-era intertwine in collaboration with the Eckhart Public Library. ](/events/museum-programs/bootleggers-ball-2026)[ Feb 21 | 1:00pmPaul R. Williams (1894–1980), the first African American member of the AIA and famed “Architect to the Stars,” designed iconic homes for Frank Sinatra, Lucille Ball, and Barbara Stanwyck, as well as landmarks like the Beverly Hills Hotel redesign and the LAX Theme Building. Hosted at the Allen County Public Library Main Branch, Genealogy Lecture Hall. ](/events/museum-programs/paul-r-williams-architectural-visions-from-hollywood-to-fort-wayne)

[View More Events](/events)
